titleStmt.title: The account audited and discounted: or, a vindication of the three-fold diatribee, of [brace] 1. Supersition, 2. Will-worship, 3. Christmas festivall. Against Doctor Hammonds manifold paradiatribees. / By D.C. preacher of the Word at Billing-Magn. in Northamptonshire.
titleStmt.author: Cawdrey, Daniel, 1588-1664.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Ralph Wood, for M. Wright, at the Kings Heads in the Old Bailey.,

notesStmt.note: A reply to Hammond, Henry. An account of Mr. Cawdry's triplex diatribe concerning superstition, wil-worship, and Christmass festivall.
The words "Superstition .. festivall" are bracketed together on title page.
At end: errata and advertisement for M. Wright.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Kings Heads in the Old Bailey.
